website_summaries.verdict: The Streaming Stick+ is Roku's most affordable model that delivers high-end features like 4K HDR.
pros: Voice control from the remote makes it super easy to find and watch your favorite streaming content in just seconds
It works with every major streaming service

website_summaries.verdict: The Roku Streaming Stick+ is a tiny, inexpensive media streamer that can put 4K and HDR10 content on your TV.
pros: Lots of content available in the Roku Channel Store
cons: Voice search is much more limited than on other media streamers

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Selection of Available Channels
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the selection of channels on the device, after it had been installed. I had bought the device in order to be able to access one particular app/channel that I had been informed (wrongly, as it turned out) would be accessible via the streaming stick. Of course, the channel/app in question was not one of the available channels/apps at all, so my purchase turned out to be a waste of money. Roku should clearly indicate all the channels that are accessible to potential customers, before they buy the device, so that people can make an informed choice as to whether the product is suitable or not. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Whiteley

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love
customer_reviews.text: I have bought four of these Roku And they are the best streaming thing ever and easy to set up it is foolproof
customer_reviews.author: Maria G.

customer_reviews.title: I love this. I used to have to link my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I used to have to link my pc to the tv but can now stream what I need from the remote. Quality is good. Could have bought it cheaper from a back street "shop" on Ebay but decided to play safe buying from here.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Get them while you can
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of these they are very good and recommend to all in the UK.
customer_reviews.author: clive

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant item worked very well
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant item worked very well. Could include or add on Roku cable And make available for Ireland. Had to get mine from amazom.com
customer_reviews.author: Milia Tsaoussis

customer_reviews.title: Anyone buying this product should be aware that the apps are all loaded on it
customer_reviews.text: The fact that you can’t your own apps was disappointing
customer_reviews.author: margaret Lillis

customer_reviews.title: No UK Plug
customer_reviews.text: Device its self is great, however the USB charger came with a non UK plug. This should be clearly mark on the description.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 returned 2
customer_reviews.text: Folks something is wrong with the remote controls for the Roku sticks. The remotes works and then all of the sudden they won't control the TV or talk to the stick anymore. I bought another one and returned the first thinking I just got a bad unit. Nope replacement unit had quit talking to the stick about 5 minutes after setting up all my passwords. Stick with the big units until Roku figures this out.
customer_reviews.author: Proline Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Already malfunctioning after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this product. I have owned it for 4 months. About a month ago it began malfunctioning. Periodically the unit will turn on, work for about 30 seconds, then simply go dead. Usually when this happens it will occur at least two times in a row. I called support and their solution was to plug it into a different HDMI port. This did not solve the problem. So I have to make another call to hopefully get a 4 month old unit replaced because it is defective. Also, the remote drains the batteries every 3 weeks. I should have purchased a fire tv stick. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe C

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around streaming stick
customer_reviews.text: The Roku Streaming Stick+ is simply awesome. It's super easy to set up, it's powered by your TV, and the signal booster that is built in to the USB cable ensures a strong wireless connection. This thing attaches entirely to the backside of your TV and is completely out of sight once it's installed. I bought this for use with a bedroom TV because I didn't want any unnecessary electronics cluttering up the room, and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Meece III

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so annoyed with my Roku! I just received it a week ago and it has major issues. Every time I turn the TV on, it takes at least a few minutes for the Roku remote to work. I’m able to turn the volume up/down, but none of the other buttons work. I’ve also had an issue where the screen goes fuzzy (picture attached) and freezes when opening an app. I had to reset the stick. I’m using this with a new 4K LG smart tv so it can’t be an issue with compatibility. I’ve had amazon fire sticks in the past and they never had these issues!
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Have had nothing but problems with this and only have it about 80 days. It works for a few days then I get errors. Takes HOURS on the phone and website. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: SidneysSis

customer_reviews.title: Horrible return
customer_reviews.text: Loved it until it stopped working normally. Now i have to restart it everytime to watch. It would have overlapping screens, no way to watch unless i restarted the system everytime. It has been over 30 days and cant get a replacement because roku says to contact whoever sold it on amazon, but those people cant be contacted.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian D

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding picture quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm SO glad I got this! 100x better than our fire stick. The picture quality is outstanding! We can get ALL the apps we were never able to before. The fire stick was so limited. We couldn't even get Vudu. And it's picture quality sucked. It would buffer too often. We have never, not once, had an issue with buffering with this Roku.(using the exact same internet and router) I only wish we would have made the switch much sooner! We love the free Roku channel on it. We will be getting another one now that we cut the cord on cable. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tara F.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Special USB To TV Adapter Needed
customer_reviews.text: Works Great and have been using Roku Products since 2010. There seams to be some confusion as to what all the unit comes with, so I have attached a picture. It does have a special power cord with a built in antenna, so you cannot a standard USB to Micro USB TV Adapter. That is why they use the older style mini USB Plug into the Stick instead of the more common Micro USB Plug like is used on the Amazon Fire Sticks and the other Roku Sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not work.....so going back to cheaper version.
customer_reviews.text: Remote and Roku stick would not communicate. After reading several online troubleshooting guides, concluded this is a common problem with this version. Going back to the regular cheaper version, which has always worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: TypeAguy

customer_reviews.title: Defective remote control. Poor warranty customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this streaming stick and the remote stopped working after 1 week. Roku technical support agreed to send me a replacement remote because it is under warranty. However, it has been two months now and Roku still has not sent me my replacement remote. I have attempted to contact them several times and they are no longer responding to my emails regarding my trouble ticket because of my defective remote.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very important that this be read
customer_reviews.text: This is important info. If you use a soundbar like I do, the Roku Streaming Stick, within 2 minutes of plugging in, with give a warning that it is overheating. If using a soundbar, please either get the free hdmi extender from Roku themselves or buy one that handles 4k. This is important info that I never saw in any reviews. The extender works fine, I just wish the product description would have mentioned it.
customer_reviews.author: colin gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Great tv again
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Picks up WiFi signal much better than cheaper models. Love it for the Spectrum app
customer_reviews.author: John Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working- voice tracks, remotes etc Junk model
customer_reviews.text: Bad model device where previous models worked & work great. Only two months after first use, it started getting hot & losing the video voice tracks intermittently. I changed the outlet but it didn’t change the hotness. I changed the micro-USB-B but that did nothing to the hotness nor voice track losses. Turning everything off and unplugging the roku streaming stick from the electricity then plugging in again returned voice tracks but intermittently. Now the stick remotes aren’t recognized at all. That’s $85 down the toilet including the second remote.
customer_reviews.author: Oakland

customer_reviews.title: Not Roku's best product
customer_reviews.text: Had it on a second TV. Worked ok for a while, not very snappy or responsive. Started to die just before the one year warranty was up. Have been dealing with Roku customer service. They are impossible. They aren't willing to stand by their product. I've spent a month on the phone with them,"try this, try that" over and over. Clearly the item was detective and not working, but they really didn't want to replace it. I could send it back to them, at my expense, to see if they could get it working.
customer_reviews.author: bbmd

customer_reviews.title: No customer suppport.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for first 9 months. Now I have dealing with customer service for last 3 months because of failures, lockups, freezes. They are totally incompetent, disorganized, lacks any signs of customer satisfaction. Buy this with a throw away expectation when it fails.
customer_reviews.author: david p.

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for fake website during installation
customer_reviews.text: To patti s response on Roku requiring a premium account. It is a fake website you went to. I fell into the same trap. Roku warns you about this in the doc provided. I still fell into the trap. During installation Roku tells you to go to specific website. If you google that website the first entry is the fake website. Installation will appear to fail and they give you a phone number to call. Those India guys will hit you up for 99$ for premium. If you type in the www address you will get the right activation code and the install will succeed Mark b
customer_reviews.author: Mark Beard

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for activation scam
customer_reviews.text: When you go to activate it fails and tells you to call a phone number. They then tell you you can't activate unless you have a registration code which costs 99.00. It is a scam do not pay to activate, try to activate on a computer not a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Plachinski

customer_reviews.title: No longer a neutral third party
customer_reviews.text: I got a Roku Streaming Stick+ last year, and it was great for a while. But despite years of calling itself a "neutral platform," Roku has recently dropped support for HBO, and has declined to add support for HBO Max or Peacock, despite the fact that its customers have been asking for it. The entire reason I bought a Roku device in the first place was that it supported all the major streaming services, but that's no longer the case, so I definitely would not buy this device again.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Fixed a Major Issue
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because a TCL Roku TV all of a sudden refused to connect to WiFi after being moved to a different room (while everything else was fine) and NO ONE was able to help. Yes, I did all the customer service turn this on, turn this off, reconnect this, etc. etc., etc., ad nauseam. This did exactly what I was hoping and restored Roku capability to the TV. Loses a star because not able to get to live TV button or add it on the Roku stick evidently so now have to use two remotes, but oh, well. Better than having to buy another TV.
customer_reviews.author: Customer1

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of the Roku Stick + units, having the same problem with both. The remote and unit frequently lose the ability to connect and I find myself taking the batteries out of the remote in order to control the Stick. I have been a Roku supporter since they first came out many years ago, this is the most frustrating unit yet. When it works, it works well, but you cannot depend on being able to use it without frustration. I purchased a Roku Ultra and I am very pleased. My recommendation, skip the Stick + and buy an ultra or a Roku 3 if you can find one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Largo

customer_reviews.title: As someone who used to love Roku - Zero stars
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned Rokus since the very first one. I replaced my Roku3 with this new one to get 802.11AC speed. I’m going to have to send it back and give up on Roku. I’ve tried changing my router to every setting known to man. I have a dozen other laptops/tablets/phones that connect fine. This Roku will not connect. Google “Roku error code 014.30” and read the countless other people with the same issue. Save yourself frustration and don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: lll

customer_reviews.title: A very  very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with each Roku product and here updated from Roku3 for my primary TV stations while having RokuTV sets on other TVs for bedroom and office. In WV where signal strength even with good routers and an extender remains neanderthal, Roku + is definitely a plus. And I love being able to load Hulu or Network rapidly and control volume at the Roku device itself. The reliability and innovation of all Roku products is a welcome change from the difficulties of Windows and most computer hard/software. All I would ask is ability to type my email on screen with a single click for choice of x.com, x.net, etc. instead of typing in each character.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: OVERHEATS and NO web browser!
customer_reviews.text: If you're watching 4K video the stick will overheat very easily. Luckily, I have 3 HDMI ports on the back of my 4K tv. I had to move the stick from HDMI 1 to HDMI 2 because the stick ruined the first port due to overheating. I have it placed in a well-ventilated area but it doesn't seem to help the issue. I have ordered an HDMI extender to get the stick away from the TV port. Hopefully, that will solve the problem. Also, the ROKU stick does NOT have a web browser! What? Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tomtex

customer_reviews.title: Major issues with this product!
customer_reviews.text: Never again! My Apple TV broke so I decided to save the money and go with Roku. Big mistake! Constantly have to sync remote and the system keeps resetting making me set it up all over again. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: NICK

customer_reviews.title: Setup is super simple, 4k picture is stellar (if programming is ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup is super simple, 4k picture is stellar (if programming is captured in 4k) and the fact that this eliminates another dust catcher is a plus. A secret bonus is that this is small enough it can be taken on vacation. Most hotels already offer free WiFi along with an HDMI capable TV. No longer are you limited to the few channels available, nor do you have to touch that icky hotel remote. Just don't leave it behind!
customer_reviews.author: Heyborne

customer_reviews.title: Horrible 4K artifacts, flaky remote
customer_reviews.text: Remote would randomly stop working and would only reconnect if batteries were removed and reinserted. Batteries are new. Did this about once per day. Worse than this, 4K video streams from Netflix or Hulu have horrible video quality, with blocking, streaking, and off-color artifacts, especially in dark areas of the picture. Same exact content when viewed through my smart TV’s apps (also over wireless-this is on a 65” Vizio) is beautiful and free of all artifacts. I prefer using a Roku due to the simplicity of the interface, but I had to return this one.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Barton

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy if using for Hulu tv
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stream Hulu tv. The performance is terrible: constantly buffering, voice/video out of sync, no images when fast forwarding so you have to guess when the commercials end, skipping/missing time in shows. It works fine with Netflix and Amazon Prime though. I’ve switched to Xbox One for Hulu and it works great, so the problems are Hulu specific.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne n

customer_reviews.title: Cable cutters! Works with YouTubeTV, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+, and CBS All Access
customer_reviews.text: Cable cutters! This Roku Streaming Stick+ works with YouTubeTV, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+, and CBS All Access. I bought a similar Roku streaming stick from BestBuy several months ago and returned it because it did not support YouTube TV. I made do with casting from my phone to my Chromecast for a while but missed the user interface of our other Roku TV. I received this on July 23, 2020. It was easy to set up, connected to my WiFi with ease, and I was watching my shows in less than 15 minutes. By the way, the packaging says Copyright 2020 Roku, Inc. Would buy again. Would recommend to a frined.
customer_reviews.author: builttodream

customer_reviews.title: FRAUD...FRAUD...FRAUD!
customer_reviews.text: WILL NOT WORK UNLESS YOU AGREE TO PAY $80-100 OVER THE COST OF THE STREAMING DEVICE ($50)..THEY TELL ME THEY WON'T ACTIVATE IT....WHAT THE ????? THE CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE ADVISED ME TO THROW IT IN THE GARBAGE AND THEN HUNG UP ON ME. ROKU THINKS THAT LITTLE OF ITS PRODUCT AND ITS CUSTOMERS.....WOW!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: fortbecky

customer_reviews.title: Super easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Really easy; easier than the Amazon Fire TV. I got this to replace my Fire TV box, being on the fifth one now; it was pretty unreliable. The Roku also gets the Amazon Prime TV, and has dedicated pushbuttons for Hulu, Netflix etc. Part of the setup is to get it to recognize the TV so it's single-button on-off, volume control from the Roku control, also nice. It has much better wifi sensitivity than my old Fire TV box, too. The only mildly annoying part of setup is that you have to go to Roku.com/connect to activate it and finish the setup. Otherwise, it's a snap, took maybe 10 minutes to install and activate Prime, Netflix, and Hulu.
customer_reviews.author: Kamuela

customer_reviews.title: WATCH OUT FOR SCAMS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother and when he tried to set it up a phone number flashed on the screen to call and when he called some guy in India wanted him to pay $200 to activate his account. THIS IS A SCAM! i don't know how the scammer got involved with this Roku device, he probably supplied it to the Amazon seller at a discount if he would add the scam, but NEVER pay anything for Roku, it's always absolutely free! I have no problem with the Roku device they work great, but I'm giving it one star because the seller somehow sold a scam with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer Dude

customer_reviews.title: Nothing bad I can say about it it’s great
customer_reviews.text: Lately I use two types of devices AppleTV and Roku Roku I use when I travel or for gas and the Apple TV is pretty much for me for my main television so this is one of the Roku is that I use in this when I take with me when I go places are use it for hotels and Airbnb’s and when I go to anywhere that I need to have my own stuff with me it’s absolutely wonderful that you plug it in and you connect to Wi-Fi and you’ve got all your stuff already on there ready to go so I absolutely love it it’s it there’s nothing bad I can say about it it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Mcmahon

customer_reviews.title: Better than sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: Roku makes transition to cord cutting extremely easy (way easier than I imagined possible.) I now have 4 of these units and have cancelled my Cable TV about 2 months ago - never looked back... a shocking world change. One thing you should be aware of: make sure you have a relatively high quality, fairly new WiFi router before you switch over. These devices need a lot of buffering and router interaction for them to work smoothly. With good internet service, these ROKU devices deliver a smooth, high quality experience.
customer_reviews.author: John in LB

customer_reviews.title: ... player for streaming and the experience was far from perfect. As the product aged its performance grew worse ...
customer_reviews.text: We were using a Sony Blue Ray DVD player for streaming and the experience was far from perfect. As the product aged its performance grew worse and worse. At the end we couldn't get through a 30 minute episode of a TV show without suffering the dreaded spinning wheel and the message "Insufficient bandwidth to play your program." Then we bought a Roku. It was like walking out of a dark cave and into the light. Superior picture quality, easy set up, simple but functional remote and an overall superior viewing experience was suddenly our reality. Don't hesitate if you are considering this purchase. You won't be sorry and you'll never look back.
customer_reviews.author: J and B

customer_reviews.title: Customer satisfaction comes first
customer_reviews.text: Well compared to my Roku ultra and my Roku express. This stream stick is garbage. My tv doesn’t see it and this stream stick is running really hot. And amazon tech support wants me to wait and see. Nope not going to mess up my new 55 inch lg tv. I am going to send this thing back. And if they give me any crap. I am shopping elsewhere. Amazon customer support has degraded lately. Sad. I just want to send this defective product back. Get something that works.
customer_reviews.author: RAMON L. PITT JR.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $50!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on May 2, and it was delivered on May 11. As of yesterday, it is no longer eligible for return to Amazon. It was great when it worked, for all of 4 weeks, or approx 40 hours. Then is start freezing up and none of the buttons on the remote would function at all. I changed the batteries, but that made no difference. The streaming stick is plugged into an electrical socket, not a USB port. Freeze, reboot, freeze, repeat. Today, it does absolutely nothing. No off/on function...completely dead. This remote is as useless as the rest of this Roku Streaming Stick +.
customer_reviews.author: jawz33

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative to satellite television
customer_reviews.text: The ROKU is easy to set up and navigate. Great Product! Lots of selections of things to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Simon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ...
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to replace my clunky "old-reliable" Roku box with the sleek Roku Stick. Last night, within 45 minutes of the 1st use, it overheated and I received the following message on my Samsung SmartTV “Your device is overheating”. The stick overheated 3 times within 90 minutes. Each time, the stick was very hot. I followed the "Unplug & wait 10 minutes until the unit is cool" directions. My TV sits on a cabinet. There are no other electronic devices near the TV and there's 10 inches between the back of the TV and the wall. I'm returning the stick and will reinstall my trusty Roku box.
customer_reviews.author: Mia7423

customer_reviews.title: Roku is great for wireless tv if you have Spectrum.
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful that having the enhanced Roku would eliminate the ‘buffering’ issue, but unfortunately I still have the problem. My internet speed is more than adequate and I have had Spectrum technical people check out the problem multiple times. They suggested Roku Plus. I think they either get a cut or they’re just trying to pass the buck for their poor service. In any event, if you don’t need enhanced service just stick with the regular Roku. It works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Thomas

customer_reviews.title: IN LOVE WITH ROKU!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my first smart TV and the Roku streaming stick+. It was a learning curve getting it set up, but fairly easy considering I'm not a techie. Everything works great and the online support for the Roku was concise. The instructions with the stick were simple and well-written. I'm watching my favorite YouTube shows now. Unusually enough, YouTube wasn't on the introductory list of channels to link to, but I just asked the internet how to add the YouTube channel and it was easy enough to do. This from a 60 year old who has not had a TV for 10 years and who has never used a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Lindsley

customer_reviews.title: Constant interruption
customer_reviews.text: I've owned multiple Roku devices over the years. I took a chance on the stick and regret the purchase. This seems to be powered by a combination of wall plug and USB port. It starts very slow. After watching for twenty minutes, it delivers a low power warning and will no longer work. USB etc is providing power, the device status light is properly illuminated. I suggest you skip this particular product and buy one of the higher quality Roku devices. Alos, this device is not portable. If you travel with it and plug it in, you get stopped with a notice that the device can only be used in your home where you first registered it. Not consumer friendly.
customer_reviews.author: W.F. Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Verrrrrrrreeeeey sssssssslllllllllloooooooooow
customer_reviews.text: What’s not slow about this thing? Maybe the amazon delivery. Everything else is slow! The remote will turn on my tv but then the Roku stick won’t respond to the remote for like 30 seconds. The download speed is much slower compared to my last Roku 4 that had a hard line. The image quality is worse. Everything about this thing is worse than the Roku 4. I ended up replacing the 4 with this one because the fan in the Roku 4 started whining horribly. This one doesn’t whine but I can make dinner in the time it takes to load a show.
customer_reviews.author: LSL

customer_reviews.title: Overheating within 60 days....no good!
customer_reviews.text: After having a nice Fire TV for a few years, we went with a Roku Stick. Bad choice. I am very unhappy that in under 60 days, the darn thing overheats! They say to put it onto an extender, and keep it away from other items. What? I don't care to have extraneous things hanging off the back of my TV. To have something almost brand new come up with overheating issues is terrible. I would not recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: GracefulGhost

customer_reviews.title: Great Streaming Device!
customer_reviews.text: Had no problem with any of the functions with this Roku Stick or hand remote communications even though the Roku stick was located in back of my TV. Setup was a breeze! Just plugged it into one of my LG 55" Smart TVs HDMI ports on back of TV. Then installed the USB power pig tail to the TVs USB port located close by. Than went online with my computer to activated my new Roku stick. Supplied installation/activation instructions were easy to follow. Found my new Roku stick was responding much faster with greater picture quality over my old 8+ year old Roku box/cable player. Really love the voice command and TV volume control functions on the new remote.
customer_reviews.author: ROGER KORtr

customer_reviews.title: poor wifi for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 other roku's the 3 and sreaming stick. Both are indeed great. Sadly I have had many disapointments with the wifi networking performance of this + stick. That is suppoused to be one of its strongest selling point! I have a netgear ac band system in my house and no other devices have issues with my wifi. This device gets only around a 6mb connection and drops connectivity all together often. It is powered buy the wall plug not the tv and is on the 5g band. All other devices connect in the multi hundreds of mb to the wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: travel tools

customer_reviews.title: Overheating and Power issues
customer_reviews.text: Tough to select stars for this - I do like the Roku price and the user interface, picture quality and general usability are all 5-star but the overheating and power warnings are a 1 star regular issue. As I have both I might return and try another. This Plus stick is connected by cables only so there is no relevant heat from the TV or receiver. This is in a ~70 degree-F room so ambient temp should not be a factor either. The only way to prevent overheating is to lay it flat against a heat sink. Also, it is already connected with the included AC adapter and extension cable but regularly indicates there is not enough power.
customer_reviews.author: Daine P

customer_reviews.title: Awesome streaming device
customer_reviews.text: I love the Roku UI. It truly surpasses the Fire Stick, so I was looking to replace my older generation Roku for our living room. This connected very easily to my existing Roku account and downloaded all of my previous apps. So far the interface is working well and the streaming quality is wonderful. The seller was awesome, they shipped the item super quickly and I received within 4 days of ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsay

customer_reviews.title: Wireless connection is good, the distance to the router(tp-link ac3200) is 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It is step up from the previous model. I do not need TV’s remote to control volume any more! I use it for Netflix and Youtube only, full HD mode. Wireless connection is good, the distance to the router(tp-link ac3200) is 6 meters including a wall. The picture is as good as it could be on my five years old Samsung plasma TV. No lags. No lags even when I rewind Netflix forward or backward, the rewinding does not affect picture quality. Cons: Volume button is on the right side of the remote control unit which is not convenient. I did not find Roku application for Amazon Prime videos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two weeks and consumed 1Tbyte of data in 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and setup, took the TV off the mount to paint put it back up. doesn't work anymore. Very flimsily power connection. My 2.2 connection was on the side of the TV it I just kinda hung there. When it worked it was great too much resetting and unplugging to be reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M Carolan

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and upgraded my Roku 2 after being informed that it was no longer going to be updated. OMG! It’s so amazing! Transforms my 10 yr old HD TV into a viewing pleasure. The speed, the clarity, being able to use my iPhone/iPad as a remote and speaker! So I ordered another Roku for my senior dad who can now plug in his headphones into his iPad to hear the TV vs blasting it to the point the walls shake.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: after initial setup, a phone number appears on screen telling you to call! Then a person from Indian answers telling you, you need to pay a one time lifetime use to roku! NOT THE CASE, it is a scam.Unsure how they taped into software...do not give any information to them,roku is a free set up!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Dennison

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect streaming stick
customer_reviews.text: I own a Apple TV, Amazon Firestick, and this Roku stick. I hooked this up to my 4K tv which also has the fire stick and this thing blows it away. I love how the remote can turn my tv on and control the volume so I can do away with the tv remote. The 4K quality is very good. Finally, the tv’s USB port provides enough power so I don’t need to plug it in. Something the firestick couldn’t do. This is hands down the best device on the market. Bonus - you can chromecast through the YouTube app.
customer_reviews.author: Sahar Pourfathi

customer_reviews.title: it functions fine. The problem is the light indicating "ON" does ...
customer_reviews.text: When it finally turns on, it functions fine. The problem is the light indicating "ON" does not turn on immediately. Conversely, the light indicating "OFF" stays on for a long time. Very frustrating. Is instant-on and instant-off not a feature of this product? And furthermore, good luck trying to find any Customer Support contact information on their website!! You have to dig deep to find an email address and if you're lucky they might get back to you. Why do they hide behind their internet screen? To screen the in-coming complaints? Not a good idea. Why is there no phone number listed for easy problem resolution?! I WISH I HAD PURCHASED SOMETHING ELSE. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME WITH ROKU!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L.

customer_reviews.title: Holy Cow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't cut the cable cord yet. This Roku is amazing! So many channels, I cant believe it! Have this hooked up to tv in the garage. No problems with reception. My router is all the way at the back of the house in our back bedroom. The extended range feature is well worth the money. So much to see and not knowing where to began. Love it!!! Highly recommend! Tried digital antenna. Forget it! Roku is the answer! Easy setup. It takes a while to set up because you choose what you want in channels. Well worth the effort! Do yourself a favor and get one for yourself. The voice remote is outstanding! ENJOY.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence L. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Roku's got problems
customer_reviews.text: This unit can only be operated with the provided roku remote. The remote consistantly loses contact with the unit, making the roku unusable until the remote and roku are sistered together again. Remove the battries to the remote Unplug the unit re-plug the unit replace batteries reprogram and re-set up the roku again, and again, and again.... This gets old real fast. Yes, I tried a few sets of fresh batteries, and I have the roku plugged into the usb and 110v outlet. On the plus side, shipping was quick and when working, the picture was good. ( two stars for that) I am returning the item ( joy joy) and looking for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Senecal

customer_reviews.title: You can have many devices registered to Roku account
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace Roku built in to TV. TV is in bedroom some distance from router and often lost signal. Roku stick plus seems to pick up signal much better than built-in Roku. It solved my problem with losing signal. I see people claiming Roku charges for additional devices--this is not true! I have seven or eight devices registered and never paid extra. I am limited to two devices streaming at once because I pay the lowest monthly fee.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: All in one remote and works great!
customer_reviews.text: My old roku bit the dust so I needed a new one. Other models were cheaper but I decided to go with this one because of the all in one remote (I was tired of having a roku remote and a tv remote to turn on the TV and adjust the volume). It all works great. The stick is plugged in behind the TV but we have no trouble changing the channels and adjusting volume which is such an improvement over our older version that you had to make sure you had a clear line of site and point it exactly right. I have only owned this for a month or 2 but I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: New lease of life on older TVs (regular and less smart ones that have built-in planned obsolencese
customer_reviews.text: It has saved my sluggish (and constantly freezing) HiSense 43-inch "Smart" LED TV . The tiny Roku stick is blindingly fast to my remote comannds, and manages to control my TV's volume and power from its single remote. It saves all the available wi-fi configs, so less typing passwords when switching to a better signal a/o internet provider. NO voice command outside USA, a inconvenient caveat that was not disclosed anywhere only after the thing is connected to my TV set. Buy the cheaper model that skips "voice" command and get the other useful features.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bello

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: The streaming device works well and is easy to connect. Package delivery was great. The disappointing feature is getting an answer to a question from customer support. I have now been waiting 3 days and so far have had only an automated response apologizing saying it doesn’t usually take this long. Kind of like the phone message saying we are busier t usual.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this or any other Roku products
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Roku streaming Stick plus. It would not activate with a code I was sent to a toll-free number to have it activated. Was then told by the service tech that I had to pay $99 for a lifetime subscription nowhere in the purchasing of this item does it say anything of the subscription. Tell them I had no intention of paying $100 for an item I have owned before and never had to pay a subscription fee. Needless to say we are severely disappointed and Roku customer service told this to this promptly return the device so that's exactly what we're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop what you are doing and get one now!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! The biggest reason I bought this is because it has a Beta app to stream from my cable company. I love that I can connect with my cable company's DVR and watch shows in the bedroom and not have to pay for another box or run wires over there. There is nothing better than sticking it to my cable provider, they suck eggs. I use Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video and others. The High Definition is clear and fast. Personally I think this is far better than any of the Amazon or Google products. Hook it up and enjoy. Plus save yourself a few sheckles buy not having to pay more to the Cable Gods!
customer_reviews.author: David Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: It was GREAT while it worked...until it didn't. It would randomly reboot in the middle of streaming. The situation quickly got worse and it would do it every couple minutes. Then the remote stopped working. Roku support was HORRENDOUS and is limited to email correspondence...about once a day. Google just came out with a chromecast with a remote. I highly recommend it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: No cost to activate if you fallow what it tells you to on screen
customer_reviews.text: i red a lot of reviews stating roku wanted $60+ to activate the device. I have 6 roku devices and have paid $0 to activate any of them. DO NOT CALL TO ACTIVATE. If you call in, yes you will be asked to pay to activate. Its simple, go to the website it tells you to fallow the on screen display type in the code and create a account when it asks for credit card imformation to be on file scroll to the bottom and click SKIP. Done, roku activated. On a quality note, this stick has great video output compared to the lower 1080p models worth the money if you want 4k
customer_reviews.author: Moyerdf

customer_reviews.title: Sorry Amazon....Way better than Fire Stick!
customer_reviews.text: I have both Fire Stick and now Roku. Sorry Amazon, Roku is wayyyyy better. Remote is so nice and so much easier to use than the Fire Stick. I am in my fifties and want a easy to use, nice remote. Streaming service is also much more user friendly. I am really happy with this purchase and rarely write reviews. Wanted to put my two cents in on this one. Five Solid Stars.
customer_reviews.author: QuietWife

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with my Sony.
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this to use as a remote with my TV. I have a Sony, and yet it is not compatible with this Roku, so it's not doing what I bought it to do. Is understand if had some random no name brand, but it's a Sony for crying out loud. I already had another Roku which worked just fine. That said, it works well as a streaming stick. One thing I'd like to see, is a way to reprogram the preset buttons, so that it would go to the apps I use most. My old stick has an Amazon button, but this has ESPN. I only use one of the four preset buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Wordsworth49

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: The new policy of Roku of not letting you code in until you call them.....then they want all of your personnel information, including a credit card number. Will not do business with Roku in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Goode

customer_reviews.title: Be wary of registration scam from WINSOC IT when activating....
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to set this up, for some reason, it would not connect....said the account was locked. When I contacted the phone number on the screen, it was from a company called WINSOC IT. They said they were the official third party biller for Roku. The phone number was 855-256-4555. It is a SCAM! Go to roku.com for help. The website showed up as official-roku.com....they tried to explain it as a “registration” charge and was new billing as of October. Nothing shows up on roku website. Great product, great streaming, but be careful when activating....
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cushing

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup, easy to hide
customer_reviews.text: it plugs in to an HDMI jack on the TV. It comes with a cord that will connect to a USB port on the TV to provide power, meaning no wall wart or extra cable running from the TV to the wall. Easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Usual Roku functionality, and so fast I now don't like using my old Roku HD.  Great wireless range too.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize just how slow my old Roku HD was until I got this for a different TV. This thing is blazing fast to navigate. Reasonably small, so you can travel with it and watch your DVR or Netflix from your hotel. Range is excellent. I actually have it at the opposite end of the house from my router, but there's been absolutely no issue with it at all, I'm very impressed (in comparison the Samsung TV that it's plugged into has 'smart' features that barely work). I'm now toying with replacing my Roku HD with one of these, even though there's nothing wrong with it - it's just so slow in comparison. Y.M.M.V.
customer_reviews.author: Witty Username

customer_reviews.title: Great Roku box
customer_reviews.text: Please note there is a scam that will redirect you to a site that will charge you to connect your Roku box. Please ensure you entered the exact URL you see on your screen when you are setting up the box. ROKU will NOT charge you to setup the box. This streaming stick is incredible. you can rid yourself of multiple remotes and just have one remote that operates our TV and streaming. The buttons that take you straight to SLING and net flicks are very nice. The rage of this remote is incredible. I can adjust my TV from across the house. Overall its a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell L. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Nice except won't cast from Windows 10 to TV
customer_reviews.text: Liked: - 4K/HDR capabilities - excellent remote functionality and layout (controls TV vol and mute) - compact size Dislike: - can't cast from Windows 10 PC but can from phone. Had no problems with previous Roku 3 and can also cast direct to TV (not through Roku) from Windows 10, so the PC is not the issue. - video quality when casting from my S10+ phone "seems" to be less sharp than with my old Roku 3
customer_reviews.author: James Bowdren

customer_reviews.title: Ask for a hard wired regular knob style channel changer it will have less issues
customer_reviews.text: Roku will never fix their remote! You have to take the batteries out of the remote daily. You also have to unplug the Roku stick every day because taking the batteries out of the remote and putting them back in again only works for about an hour or so, then when that stops working you have to go back and unplug the Roku to have a 50% chance that it fixes the issue. Roku knows this is a problem and they refuse to fix it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great except there is a glitch with YouTube TV
customer_reviews.text: We love this except for the problem we (an several others) experience when watching YouTube TV. It will go to the ads and then when the ads are over, it freezes and will not come back. Lately even when going completely out and going back in, it will not allow me to finish watching the program that I was watching. One day will be fine, then will go off for three or more day in a row. BTW, Amazon will not allow you to purchase more than three devices. No idea why not. I had to order from elsewhere for the rest of my TV's.
customer_reviews.author: jshiver

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We were having issues(no sound) and when we put in a different Roku, it worked fine. Unfortunately we can’t do anything about it now, but I would have thought it would have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Luanne

customer_reviews.title: This Roku is not like the others- can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Roku device I have bought to add to TVs in my house. They all still work and were easy to set up, however this device is unlike any other I have purchased. Although it is supposedly the same as the original Roku stick I purchased on Amazon, this one interrupts my TV streaming with Roku pop-up ads or suddenly forcing me to download a new app/channel that I don't want. Both of these interruptions close the app/channel I was using, and make me manually go back, as if I just turned it on. I don't know why this one is different, but I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSucks

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I have finally been able to sit down (Covid 19 stay at home order) to install Roku. When I did, it comes up with Missing Advanced Wireless Receiver. I have installed the Receiver that came with this item. If another receiver is needed, then there is some level of deception. If no other AWR is needed except what came in the box which is what I believe, then the product is defective. I was about to have it replaced but my return window is passed by 2 days. That is unfair that I have to purchase a new product due to a defective AWR. Why would I need a AWR if my product came with a long range wireless receiver?
customer_reviews.author: carmen

customer_reviews.title: Remote Constantly Loses Connection With Stick
customer_reviews.text: First all I love the Roku streamers. I have an Roku Ultra downstairs in our dedicated Home Theater. It works flawlessly. The remote works with the Roku being out of site. This Roku Stick is used on our upstairs TV. And it the remote is always losing connection with the stick. I’ll get up and use it close to the stick and then it activates. But when it’s idle for awhile, again it loses the interface. It’s a disappointment and I’m going to replace it with another Roku Ultra. One question for Roku-When are you going to be able to stream Dolby Atmos through other streaming services like Netflix?
customer_reviews.author: Seawater

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for Plex, like all Roku products
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use Plex on my Roku devices, with some Amazon Video / Netflix / Hulu in the mix. This Streaming Stick is, like all Roku products I've tried, easy to set up, fast, responsive and works brilliantly with the above-mentioned services. I just wish the #&*@! branded shortcut buttons on the remote could be reprogrammed or at least disabled! Few things are more frustrating than accidentally pressing one of them and being abruptly kicked out of whatever I'm watching and dumped into a different service.
customer_reviews.author: David M Hollway

customer_reviews.title: Crash and burn
customer_reviews.text: This streaming stick consistently overheats and crashes after a few hours of use. The manufacturer provided an extension cable that was supposed to fix the problem but it doesn't. Now It loses the voice stream after a few hours of use and eventually crashes and loses its information regarding streaming services. It also pulls more power from the usb port than the Sony Bravia is willing to provide. I have used roku devices for many years and this is the worst product I have had from Roku. I would not buy again and I would not reccommend it to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Cord Pulls Out
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this due to no place to mount a roku box and it works perfectly however due to the fact my TV is wall mounted the cord that comes out of the USB roku unit itself from the TV creates weight so as you can see from photograph if your electric outlet isn’t high enough it’s going to get pulled down on. The wire has already pulled out once so I will have to improvise and plug all cords into thick electric cord and mount it up behind tv to prevent it from pulling out due to the weighted force of the cord. Other than that it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Best performance and value.
customer_reviews.text: I switched from Direct TV to You Tube TV. I purchased 4 Roku Streaming Stick Plus sticks, one for each TV. I decided on these over other streaming sticks because they were the most affordable and had the highest ratings. I am super impressed on how easy they were to set up and use. They have great WiFi speed with no buffering. My Samsung smart tv’s often buffer especially while watching 4K programs, but not these Roku’s. They offer great performance and value. You Tube TV is pretty awesome also.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but with one or two issues.
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these after abandoning our pricey satellite TV. Have found in general that the Rokus work well, though they are quite prone to locking up, meaning they need to be rebooted 1-2 times per week. That is frustrating but acceptable considering I’m saving a bunch of money by ditching the satellite. Streaming quality is variable, from super high resolution to glitchy and pixelated but that is more to do with our bandwidth and my gaming son than the Roku. Overall I like the ROku and would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Objective Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: No Support, Can't activate the product.
customer_reviews.text: ROKU must be a foreign company with no one to support the product. I can't log on, they say they will email a link to update my password but they don't. Call their support line 816-272-0000 and listen to the automated message. What a joke! I signed up for a monthly subscription thru YouTube TV and can not cancel it. I am writing the FCC and asking for them to research the company for FRAUD....
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Johnston

customer_reviews.title: No faster than cheaper models
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 stars 1 point off for it’s dated looking interface. Slugish compared to the ultra Roku. Huge negative is it actually has a huge ad on the main home screen. Guess they saw amazon was getting away with it, so they started doing it too. Blows away the Amazon sticks IMO. The amazon stick is all about shoving prime, ads, and amazon down your throats. Between the two, go roku for sure. Personally I'd either get the Roku ultra, or the cheapest Roku available. This product isn't really any faster than the cheaper models
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Great for flexibility, works great
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you go to the roku page to activate, there are scammers trying to get you to pay to set it up. I made a few errors before I got to the correct page, but then It was pretty straight forward, and NO COST. I plan to use in different rooms in the house, and take on the road when traveling. I had no issue with the plugs not being long enough, they provided all that was needed. Our cable company doesn’t have Hulu rights so this was one way to watch our. Hulu subscription. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: terriz

customer_reviews.title: Different remote than what they clearly depict on the website, got ESPN Button and not Disney!
customer_reviews.text: It's such as amazon sham to depict the Disney quick button on the remote in all their images to only send you the original ESPN button on the remote which was their original set. I wanted what was depicted which was the "Netflix, Hulu, Disney, Sling" what I got was Netflix, Hulu, ESPN, Sling" They should send you the correct remote that is advertised an option or which remote you want. I'll be speaking with Disney that amazon is not sending people the Disney remote they advertise and paying Roku a lot of money for.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Nice money saver.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to replace an Xfinity box that Comcast charges $10 per month to rent. Download the Xfinity app for Roku and the thing works great. The voice remote works. However, with that said, it does have some limitations. Using the Roku voice remote you can search for Roku apps, but you can't search for channels within the app. Example. in the Xfinity app, you say "History Channel" into the remote, and Roku pulls up the History Vault app for Roku, not the History Channel. Otherwise, no complaints. And I'm saving $120/year on rental.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi Bear

customer_reviews.title: Roku is very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Roku is easy to install and the remote is so simple and uncomplicated. I switched from Directv to Directv Now and, after reading several reviews, decided on Roku Streaming stick + because of my 2K/5K router. I've noticed no difference in picture quality and I don't have to be bothered with losing the feed due to weather as I used to with Directv. I've converted all of my TV's to Roku SS+ and it has been well worth it. With the $90/month I'm saving by going to Directv Now the payback will only be 2 months. Roku also offers Acorn TV which is great if you're into foreign television (the stuff you usually see on PBS.)
customer_reviews.author: D Carls

customer_reviews.title: Yeah! This is worth it all the way.
customer_reviews.text: Dude! Roku Makes watching pretty much WHATever, WHEREever, from WHATever not only possible, but fingertip easy possible. I had no idea it was this stupid simple. I tried to play World of Warships on it...I did. It wasn't pretty. I logged in. I hung out. I did Not play a battle. There was no way that was happening. The fact that I even got as far into the game that I did says a lot about that tiny little beast. Fact is I don't have the best gaming router Archer A10 (it's no slouch either). Still a couple levels higher maybe.... Phone games should work like a charm. The point is this stick works well.
customer_reviews.author: michael Morin

customer_reviews.title: Froze on the Screen Saver page.
customer_reviews.text: The new Roku Streaming Stick+ cost me over $68 worked fine for exactly two months, and then it froze on the Roku Screen Saver Page. Customer Service was pleasant and nice but unable to resolve the defect issue. Since it was out of the 30 day return limit but still under warranty, I had to ship it back to Roku Returns at my expense for a refurbished replacement. Still waiting for the replacement Stick and have purchased a Amazon Fire Stick in the mean time.
customer_reviews.author: Gene C

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and use. Bought the Roku stick as our "Smart TV" was not so smart anymore! Able to subscribe to more streaming services which is the main reason for buying! Did my research between the Roku stick and Amazon Firestick. Everyone I talked to that had both, recommended the Roku stick over Amazon Firebox or Firestick. Even the comments I got from people who had one or the other recommended the Roku stick!
customer_reviews.author: Christine B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Not what it's cooked up to be
customer_reviews.text: Not what it's cooked up to be this Roku stick. There's lots of channels, but the content of the free channels is totally out dated, programs from decades ago and the movies are no block busters, only the pay channels are worth it but it's like having cable but by different providers because.... yes you have to pay.
customer_reviews.author: rudy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product; easy installation
customer_reviews.text: The Roku Streaming Stick+ was amazingly easy to install. I had worried that its placement in an HDMI port on the back of my tv would make the remote awkward to use - no such thing. It works flawlessly. I had also wondered how to program the remote so I could power on/off my tv and adjust its volume. That was a seamless process - it asked me if I could hear music, I said yes, and it was done. The streaming quality is outstanding and it is very quick, no blips. I’ve used Roku for years on multiple TVs, and this one is the best one yet.
customer_reviews.author: customer

product_meta.title: Roku Streaming Stick+ | HD/4K/HDR Streaming Device with Long-range Wireless and Voice Remote with TV Controls (updated for 2019)
product_meta.description:
Powerful & portable. 4K & HDR streaming with long range wireless.



Powerful and portable, Roku Streaming Stick+ is super charged with a long range wireless receiver for 4x the range and brilliant HD, 4K, and HDR picture quality. You’ll enjoy a stronger signal for smooth streaming even in rooms farther from your router.



The included voice remote features buttons to turn on your TV, control the volume, mute, and search across channels with your voice. With easy access to free TV, live news, sports, movies, and more on hundreds of free channels, there’s plenty to enjoy without spending extra.
feature_bullets: New! Disney+ and Apple TV are now streaming on all Roku devices

Wireless that goes the distance: Basement rec room? Backyard movie night? Bring ‘em on. The long-range wireless receiver gives you up to 4x the range and a stronger signal for smooth streaming even in rooms farther from your router

Brilliant picture quality: Experience your favorite shows with stunning detail and clarity—whether you’re streaming in HD, 4K, or HDR, you’ll enjoy picture quality that’s optimized for your TV with sharp resolution and vivid color

Tons of power, tons of fun: Snappy and responsive, you’ll stream your favorites with ease—from movies and series on Apple TV, Prime Video, Netflix, to cable alternatives like Sling, enjoy the most talked-about TV across thousands of channels

No more juggling remotes: Power up your TV, adjust the volume, mute, and control your streaming all with one remote—use your voice to quickly search across channels, turn captions on, and more in a touch
Setup is a cinch: Plug it in, connect to the internet, and start streaming—it’s that simple
Private listening on mobile: Use the free Roku mobile app to pump up the volume on your shows without disturbing the house

Endless entertainment: Stream what you love, including free TV, live news, sports, and more; Never miss the most talked-about events, award-winning shows, latest blockbuster hits, and more—It’s easy to stream what you love and cut back on cable bills
